Wait, but wait—does a tie count as a loss? No, because a loss would mean the team lost the game, resulting in a win/loss record. A tie doesn't affect the win-loss record but does affect the overall record with a tie. So in this context, a tie is neither a win nor a loss.

So, focusing back on October, weeks 3 and 4: both are wins for the Colts. Therefore, the claim that they didn't lose any games in October 1967 seems to hold true because they only had two games that month, both of which were wins.
